metric: % active smokers (GPPS)
numerator_description: Self-reported active smokers (GPPS survey)

numerator_description: Self-reported former smokers (GPPS survey)

metric: 62 day wait from suspected cancer or referral to first definitive treament (proportion outside of standard)
numerator_description: Number treated within 62 days (all referrals)

numerator_description: Patients with atrial fibrillation, as recorded on practice disease registers (QOF)

metric: Average daily proportion of patients who no longer meet the criteria to reside that remain in hospital
numerator_description: Average number of daily patients remaining in hospital who no longer meet the criteria to reside
denominator_description: Average number of daily patients who no longer meet the criteria to reside

metric: CVD-PP: QOF prevalence (30-74 yrs) - retired after 2019/20
numerator_description: Patients aged 30-74 yrs, with a new diagnosis of hypertension, excluding those with a pre-existing coronary heart disease (CHD), diabetes and stroke/transient ischaemic attack (TIA); (CVD-PP register) (QOF)
denominator_description: Total number of patients aged 30-74 yrs registered with the practice.

metric: Depression: QOF prevalence (18+ yrs)
numerator_description: All patients aged 18 or over, diagnosed on or after 1 April 2006, who have an unresolved record of depression in their patient record (QOF)
denominator_description: All patients aged 18 or over registered at a GP Practice in England.

metric: Last BP reading of patients (80+ yrs, with hypertension), in the last 12 months is <= 150/90 mmHg (denominator incl. PCAs)
numerator_description: Patients (<80 yrs) on the hypertension register, whose last recorded blood pressure is 140/90 mmHg or less. This reading should have been taken in the preceding 12 months.
denominator_description: Patients (< 80yrs) on the hypertension register (which includes patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale)

metric: Last BP reading of patients (<80 yrs, with hypertension), in the last 12 months is <= 140/90 mmHg (denominator incl. PCAs)
numerator_description: Patients (80+ yrs) on the hypertension register whose last recorded blood pressure is 150/90 mmHg or less. This reading should have been taken in the preceding 12 months.
denominator_description: Patients (80+ yrs) on the hypertension register (which includes patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale).

numerator_description: Total number of patients with learning disabilities, as recorded on the practice disease register (QOF)
denominator_description: Total number of patients registered with the practice.

denominator_description: Total number of patients on the practice list aged 45 or over (includes exceptions/patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale).

metric: Proportion of A&E attendances greater than 4 hours (Total attendances)
numerator_description: Number of A&E attendances that had a greater than 4 hours wait between arrival to admission, transfer or discharge (total attendances)

metric: Proportion of incomplete pathways greater than 18 weeks from referral
numerator_description: Incompleted pathways greater than 18 weeks
denominator_description: Total number of incomplete pathways at each monthly reporting snapshot

metric: Proportion of incomplete pathways greater than 52 weeks from referral
numerator_description: Incompleted pathways greater than 52 weeks
denominator_description: Total number of incomplete pathways at each monthly reporting snapshot

metric: Proportion of incomplete pathways greater than 65 weeks from referral
numerator_description: Incompleted pathways greater than 65 weeks
denominator_description: Total number of incomplete pathways at each monthly reporting snapshot

metric: Record of offer of support and treatment in the last 24 months for smokers aged 15+ yrs (denominator incl. PCAs)
numerator_description: Patients recorded as current smokers (15+ yrs) who have been offered support and treatment for smoking cessation within the preceding 24 months.
denominator_description: Total number of patients recorded as current smokers (includes exceptions/patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale).

metric: Smoking Prevalence in adults (18+) - current smokers (APS)
numerator_description: The number of persons aged 18 + who are self-reported smokers in the Annual Population Survey. The number of respondents has been weighted in order to improve representativeness of the sample. The weights take into account survey design and non-response.Note: The count as displayed in Fingertips is the prevalence for each area applied to the ONS mid-year population estimates. It is not the count of respondents who answered the survey. Rather, it is an estimate of the total number of smokers within each locality.
denominator_description: Total number of respondents (with valid recorded smoking status) aged 18+ from the Annual Population Survey. The number of respondents has been weighted in order to improve representativeness of the sample. The weights take into account survey design and non-response.

metric: Smoking cessation support and treatment offered to patients with certain conditions (denominator incl. PCAs)
numerator_description: Number of patients on any of the following registers: coronary heart disease, PAD, stroke or TIA, hypertension, diabetes, COPD, CKD, asthma, schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder or other psychoses who smoke and were given smoking cessation advice.
denominator_description: Patients with any or any combination of the following conditions: coronary heart disease, PAD, stroke or TIA, hypertension, diabetes, COPD, CKD, asthma, schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder or other psychoses who smoke (includes exceptions/patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale).

metric: Smoking status of patients with certain conditions recorded in the last 12 months (denominator incl. PCAs)
numerator_description: Patients on one or more of the disease registers for each of the conditions listed (see Definition) whose smoking status is recorded.
denominator_description: The sum of the number of patients on the disease registers for each of the conditions listed in the indicator. Any patient who has one or more co-morbidities e.g. diabetes and CHD, is only counted once (includes exceptions/patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale).

metric: Smoking: QOF prevalence (15+ yrs)
numerator_description: The number of patients aged 15+ yrs who are recorded as current smokers. For 2021/22, the denominator of SMOK004 was used as the numerator, because smoking prevalence was not included in the published QOF prevalence file (QOF)
denominator_description: Practice list size for patients aged 15 yrs and over.

metric: new hypertension patients, aged 30-74, with a CV risk assessment >= 20% treated with statins (denominator incl. PCAs) - retired after 2019/20
numerator_description: Patients aged 30-74 yrs, with a new diagnosis of hypertension recorded between the preceding 1 April to 31 March (excluding those with a pre-existing CHD, diabetes, stroke and/or TIA), who have a recorded CVD risk assessment score (using an assessment tool agreed with the NHS CB) of Ã¢Â‰Â¥ 20% in the preceding 12 months and are currently treated with statins.
denominator_description: Patients with a new diagnosis of hypertension (excluding those with pre-existing CHD, diabetes, stroke and/or TIA) recorded between the preceding 1 April to 31 March (includes exceptions/patients with Personal Care Adjustments (PCAs); for more details see Rationale).
